body: Maybe I googled improperly, but it's really hard to find information on backpressure.

comments.body: Is there any way to have a workaround? e.g. not kill the DB with lots of requests etc.. The only thing is coming in my mind is delays based on DB timeout response.

Temporal already has lots of service protection baked in the system to protect DB from getting overloaded.  There are many dynamic config knobs exposed by the system so operators can tune them for their specific needs.  Most basic one is service [rps](https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/master/service/frontend/service.go#L66) to protect Temporal service to get overwhelmed by single namespace.  Another system wide dynamic config knob is [PersistenceMaxQPS](https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/master/service/frontend/service.go#L57) which serves to protect database from getting overwhelmed by the service.  
Do you have a specific back pressure use case in mind?  I can point you in the right direction if you can provide more details.

title: First Level back pressure support
